## Loading Data 
```{r first, echo=TRUE}
library(tidyverse)
od <- read.csv('wa_od_main_JT00_2015.csv')
rac <- read.csv('wa_rac_S000_JT00_2015.csv')
wac <- read.csv('wa_wac_S000_JT00_2015.csv')


tot_jobs <- od[c("w_geocode", "S000")]
tot_jobs_10 <- head(arrange(tot_jobs, desc(tot_jobs$S000)),10)
barplot(od$S000,
names.arg = od$w_geocode,
main = "Total Jobs By WAC Tracts",
xlab = "WAC Codes",
ylab = "Number of Jobs",
col = "darkred",)

hist(od$SE01, col=rgb(1,0,0,0.7), alpha=0.3, xlim=c(0,60), ylim=c(0,100), main="Number of Jobs Overlayed with SE01 & SE02", xlab="Number of Jobs By Salary")
hist(od$SE02, col=rgb(1,1,0,0.4), alpha=0.7, add=T)
box()

hist(od$SE02, col=rgb(1,1,0,0.7), alpha=0.3, xlim=c(0,200), ylim=c(0,100), main="Number of Jobs Overlayed with SE02 & SE03", xlab="Number of Jobs By Salary")
hist(od$SE03, col=rgb(0,1,1,0.4), alpha=0.7, add=T)
box()


require(tidyr)
library(ggplot2)
data_long <- gather(edu_all, variable, value, edu1:edu4, factor_key=TRUE, -wcodes)
ggplot(data_long,aes(x=wcodes,y=value,fill=variable))+
  geom_point(size=2,shape = 23)


```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
